query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Tant’ eran li occhi miei fissi e attenti 2 a disbramarsi la decenne sete, 3 che li altri sensi m’eran tutti spenti.
query.error: **English:** 1 So fixed and intent were my eyes 2 on satisfying their ten-year thirst, 3 that all my other senses were extinguished.
query.result: 1 Swa wæron mine eagan fæste and georne 2 on ðam ðæt hi woldon ða tyn-geara ðurst gestillan, 3 ðæt ða oðre witan wæron me ealle adwæscte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Ed essi quinci e quindi avien parete 5 di non caler—così lo santo riso 6 a sé traéli con l’antica rete!—;
query.error: **English:** 4 And they on this side and that have a wall 5 of not caring—thus the holy laughter 6 draws them to itself with the ancient net!—
query.result: 4 And ða on ðisum and ðam oðrum healfe hafað ða weallas 5 ðæs ðe ne caran—swa ðæt halige hleahtor 6 to him ða teohð mid ðam ealdan nette!—

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 quando per forza mi fu vòlto il viso 8 ver’ la sinistra mia da quelle dee, 9 perch’ io udi’ da loro un «Troppo fiso!»;
query.error: **English:** 7 when by force my face was turned 8 toward my left by those goddesses, 9 because I heard from them a “Too fixedly!”;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 e la disposizion ch’a veder èe 11 ne li occhi pur testé dal sol percossi, 12 sanza la vista alquanto esser mi fée.
query.error: **English:** 10 and the disposition that is to be seen 11 in the eyes just now struck by the sun, 12 made me somewhat lose my sight.
query.result: 10 and ða gesceaft ðe is to geseonne 11 on ðam eagum ða ðe ða ða sunne sloh, 12 ða worhte ðæt ic wæs sum þing blind.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Ma poi ch’al poco il viso riformossi 14 (e dico ‘al poco’ per rispetto al molto 15 sensibile onde a forza mi rimossi),
query.error: **English:** 13 But when my sight had somewhat re-formed itself 14 (and I say “somewhat” in comparison to the much 15 light from which I had perforce withdrawn),
query.result: 13 Ac ða ða ðæt gesihð somod eft onwoc, 14 (and ic secge “somod” wið ðone miclan 15 leoman ðe ic ðær ðurh ðearfe forlet),

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 vidi ’n sul braccio destro esser rivolto 17 lo glorïoso essercito, e tornarsi 18 col sole e con le sette fiamme al volto.
query.error: **English:** 16 I saw the glorious host wheeling on my right arm, 17 and returning with the sun and the seven flames in front of them.
query.result: 16 ða geseah ic ðone mæran here on ða swiðran hand 17 bewendne, and eft cyrrende 18 mid ðære sunnan and ðam seofon leoman on andwlitan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Come sotto li scudi per salvarsi 20 volgesi schiera, e sé gira col segno, 21 prima che possa tutta in sé mutarsi;
query.error: **English:** 19 As beneath their shields to save themselves 20 a squadron turns, and wheels with its standard, 21 before it can change its formation;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 quella milizia del celeste regno 23 che procedeva, tutta trapassonne 24 pria che piegasse il carro il primo legno.
query.error: **English:** 22 that soldiery of the celestial kingdom 23 which was advancing, passed all through 24 before the chariot had moved the first rank.
query.result: 22 seo fyrd ðæs heofonlican rices 23 ðe ðær forð gewat, eal ðurh ða wæs 24 ær ðæt ðone forman feðan hweowol.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Indi a le rote si tornar le donne, 26 e ’l grifon mosse il benedetto carco 27 sì, che però nulla penna crollonne.
query.error: **English:** 25 Then the ladies returned to their wheels, 26 and the griffin moved the blessed burden 27 so that not a single feather shook.
query.result: 25 Þa wendon ða wimmen to heora hweolum, 26 and se grifða beweg ðone eadigan byrðen 27 swa ðæt nænig feðer ne hreop.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 La bella donna che mi trasse al varco 29 e Stazio e io seguitavam la rota 30 che fé l’orbita sua con minore arco.
query.error: **English:** 28 The beautiful lady who led me to the pass, 29 and Statius and I followed the wheel 30 that made its orbit with a smaller arc.
query.result: 28 Seo fægere wif ðe me ðurh ðone weg gelædde, 29 and Statius and ic ða rode folgodon, 30 ðe hire ymbhwyrft geworhte mid læssan bogan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Sì passeggiando l’alta selva vòta, 32 colpa di quella ch’al serpente crese, 33 temprava i passi un’angelica nota.
query.error: **English:** 31 Thus, walking, I turned to the high wood, 32 the fault of her who believed the serpent, 33 an angelic sound tempered my steps.
query.result: 31 Þus ic ferde, ða ic ða fægrian wudu 32 geseah ðurh ðæs wyrmes geleafan, 33 ða ðær engle stefn stiðe gemet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Forse in tre voli tanto spazio prese 35 disfrenata saetta, quanto eramo 36 rimossi, quando Bëatrice scese.
query.error: **English:** 34 Perhaps in three flights of an arrow 35 a wild arrowhead covered as much space 36 as we moved away, when Beatrice descended.
query.result: 34 Fordon ðrim flocan ðæs fleogende stræles 35 unbindende beorgas ðone grundhyrde, 36 swa fela stigraðe we ða ða Beatrice gestod.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Io senti’ mormorare a tutti «Adamo»; 38 poi cerchiaro una pianta dispogliata 39 di foglie e d’altra fronda in ciascun ramo.
query.error: **English:** 37 I heard everyone murmur "Adam"; 38 then they circled a tree stripped 39 of leaves and other foliage on every branch.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 La coma sua, che tanto si dilata 41 più quanto più è sù, fora da l’Indi 42 ne’ boschi lor per altezza ammirata.
query.error: **English:** 40 His crown, which spreads out so much 41 the higher it is, would be admired in the forests of India 42 for its height.
query.result: 40 His helm, ðe swa wide spret, 41 ðe hehrere he was, ðe mare was on ðam heafde, 42 on ðam wudu wundrað for ðære hehðe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 «Beato se’, grifon, che non discindi 44 col becco d’esto legno dolce al gusto, 45 poscia che mal si torce il ventre quindi».
query.error: **English:** 43 Blessed are you, griffin, that do not descend 44 with your beak to this wood sweet to the taste, 45 since the belly is then twisted badly.
query.result: 43 Eala ðu eadig, grif, ðe ðu ne alihte 44 mid ðinum bile to ðysum wudu wynsumum, 45 forðæm ðe ðær ðone innoð yfle wrixleð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Così dintorno a l’albero robusto 47 gridaron li altri; e l’animal binato: 48 «Sì si conserva il seme d’ogne giusto».
query.error: **English:** 46 Thus around the sturdy tree 47 the others cried out; and the two-formed beast: 48 "Thus is preserved the seed of every just man."
query.result: 46 Swa ymb ðone beam beorna gehwylce 47 hrymdon; and ðæt hyrnedneor: 48 "Þus bið gehealden holme gehwylces."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 E vòlto al temo ch’elli avea tirato, 50 trasselo al piè de la vedova frasca, 51 e quel di lei a lei lasciò legato.
query.error: **English:** 49 And turning to the shaft that he had pulled, 50 he dragged it to the foot of the widowed stump, 51 and left hers bound to it.
query.result: 49 And gewende ða to ðæm sceafte ðe he ær oftuh, 50 and hit teoh ðære wuduwan treowe, 51 and hire ðær gebunden læfde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Come le nostre piante, quando casca 53 giù la gran luce mischiata con quella 54 che raggia dietro a la celeste lasca,
query.error: **English:** 52 Like our plants, when the great light falls 53 down mixed with that which radiates behind 54 the celestial slab,
query.result: 52 Swa swa ure wyrta, ðonne hryseð 53 niðer se micla leoht gemenged mid ðæm 54 ðe scineð æfter ðære heofonlican læsan,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 turgide fansi, e poi si rinovella 56 di suo color ciascuna, pria che ’l sole 57 giunga li suoi corsier sotto altra stella;
query.error: **English:** 55 become turgid, and then each one renews 56 its own color, before the sun 57 yokes his steeds beneath another constellation;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 men che di rose e più che di vïole 59 colore aprendo, s’innovò la pianta, 60 che prima avea le ramora sì sole.
query.error: **English:** 58 less than roses and more than violets 59 in color, the plant renewed itself, 60 which before had its branches so bare.
query.result: 58 læsse ðonne rosan and mare ðonne fiolan 59 hiw ontynende, onnywode se wyrt, 60 se ær hæfde ða telgan swa nacode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Io non lo ’ntesi, né qui non si canta 62 l’inno che quella gente allor cantaro, 63 né la nota soffersi tutta quanta.
query.error: **English:** 61 I did not understand it, nor is it sung here, 62 the hymn that those people sang then, 63 nor did I endure the whole melody.
query.result: 61 Ic ne gehyrde hit, ne her nis gesungen 62 ðæt lof ðe ða leoda ðær sungon, 63 ne ða note ic ne geþolode ealle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 S’io potessi ritrar come assonnaro 65 li occhi spietati udendo di Siringa, 66 li occhi a cui pur vegghiar costò sì caro;
query.error: **English:** 64 If I could portray how they fell asleep, 65 their pitiless eyes hearing of Syrinx, 66 eyes for which staying awake had cost them so dearly;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 come pintor che con essempro pinga, 68 disegnerei com’ io m’addormentai; 69 ma qual vuol sia che l’assonnar ben finga.
query.error: **English:** 67 like a painter who paints with a model, 68 I would depict how I fell asleep; 69 but let whoever wants to imagine it well.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Però trascorro a quando mi svegliai, 71 e dico ch’un splendor mi squarciò ’l velo 72 del sonno, e un chiamar: «Surgi: che fai?».
query.error: **English:** 70 Therefore I pass over to when I awoke, 71 and I say that a brightness tore open the veil 72 of sleep, and a voice called: "Rise: what are you doing?".
query.result: 70 Forðæm ic oferfare ða ða ic awoc, 71 and secge ðæt an leoht min tobræc ðone wæl 72 slæpes, and an stefn clypode: "Aris: hwæt dest ðu?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Quali a veder de’ fioretti del melo 74 che del suo pome li angeli fa ghiotti 75 e perpetüe nozze fa nel cielo,
query.error: **English:** 73 Like seeing the little flowers of the apple tree 74 that make the angels greedy for its fruit 75 and make perpetual weddings in heaven,
query.result: 73 Swylce ða lytlan blostman on æppeltreowe 74 ðe ðæs wæstmes englas gylpð, 75 and on heofonum hæleðum brydgifaeste,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Pietro e Giovanni e Iacopo condotti 77 e vinti, ritornaro a la parola 78 da la qual furon maggior sonni rotti,
query.error: **English:** 76 Peter and John and James, led 77 and overcome, returned to the word 78 by which they had been awakened from greater sleep,
query.result: 76 Petrus and Iohannes and Iacobus gelædde 77 and oferwunnen, to ðam worde eft gewendon, 78 ðe hi ær of slæpe swiðor awecce,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 e videro scemata loro scuola 80 così di Moïsè come d’Elia, 81 e al maestro suo cangiata stola;
query.error: **English:** 79 and they saw their company diminished 80 both of Moses and of Elijah, 81 and their master's clothing changed;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 tal torna’ io, e vidi quella pia 83 sovra me starsi che conducitrice 84 fu de’ miei passi lungo ’l fiume pria.
query.error: **English:** 82 thus I returned, and I saw that pious one 83 standing over me, who was the guide 84 of my steps along the river before.
query.result: 82 swa ic eft gewende, and ða geseah ða arfæstan 83 ofer me standan ðe me ær lædde 84 ofer ða ea byrig minra feta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 E tutto in dubbio dissi: «Ov’ è Beatrice?». 86 Ond’ ella: «Vedi lei sotto la fronda 87 nova sedere in su la sua radice.
query.error: **English:** 85 And all in doubt I said: "Where is Beatrice?" 86 And she: "See her beneath the foliage 87 new, sitting upon its root.
query.result: 85 And eall on tweon ic cwæð: "Hwær is Beatrice?" 86 And heo: "Locað heo ðær under ðære leafan 87 niwan sittan ofer ðære hyre wyrtruman."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Vedi la compagnia che la circonda: 89 li altri dopo ’l grifon sen vanno suso 90 con più dolce canzone e più profonda».
query.error: **English:** 88 See the company that surrounds her: 89 the others follow the griffin upward 90 with a sweeter and deeper song.
query.result: 88 Gesyh ða gefylced þe heo onfongeð: 89 ða oðre æfter ðam griðfule fleogað 90 mid swinsendre and deoplicre stemne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 E se più fu lo suo parlar diffuso, 92 non so, però che già ne li occhi m’era 93 quella ch’ad altro intender m’avea chiuso.
query.error: **English:** 91 And if his speech was more diffuse, 92 I do not know, because already in my eyes was 93 she who had closed me off to understanding anything else.
query.result: 91 Andgifhisspræcmæremawæsmare, 92 natic,forðæmðeðænægonminumwæs 93 ðeoðeðeðætoðrumðingumhæfdebelocen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Sola sedeasi in su la terra vera, 95 come guardia lasciata lì del plaustro 96 che legar vidi a la biforme fera.
query.error: **English:** 94 Alone she sat upon the true earth, 95 like a guard left there of the chariot 96 that I saw bound to the two-formed beast.
query.result: 94 Ana sīo sæt on ðære sõðan eorðan, 95 swā weard gelæfed ðær ðæs wænes 96 ðe ic geseah gebunden ðære twyhyndan deore.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 In cerchio le facevan di sé claustro 98 le sette ninfe, con quei lumi in mano 99 che son sicuri d’Aquilone e d’Austro.
query.error: **English:** 97 In a circle the seven nymphs made a cloister of themselves, 98 with those lights in their hands 99 that are safe from the north wind and the south wind.
query.result: 97 Onhring ða seofon nimfe him to claðre 98 mid ðam leohte on handa, 99 ðe sindon wære wederwindes and suðan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 «Qui sarai tu poco tempo silvano; 101 e sarai meco sanza fine cive 102 di quella Roma onde Cristo è romano.
query.error: **English:** 100 "Here you will be a woodland dweller for a short time; 101 and you will be a citizen with me without end 102 of that Rome where Christ is a Roman."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Però, in pro del mondo che mal vive, 104 al carro tieni or li occhi, e quel che vedi, 105 ritornato di là, fa che tu scrive».
query.error: **English:** 103 Therefore, for the good of the world that lives badly, 104 keep your eyes on the chariot now, and what you see, 105 when you return from there, make sure you write down.
query.result: 103 For ði, for ðæs weorold ðe yfele libbað, 104 geheald nu ðin eagan to ðæm cræte, and ðæt ðu ðær gesihst, 105 ðonne ðu ðanon eft cymest, writ ðu ða word.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Così Beatrice; e io, che tutto ai piedi 107 d’i suoi comandamenti era divoto, 108 la mente e li occhi ov’ ella volle diedi.
query.error: **English:** 106 Thus Beatrice; and I, who was devoted at the feet 107 of her commands, 108 gave my mind and eyes where she wished.
query.result: 106 Þus cwæð Beatrijs; and ic, se ðe eallum hire bebodum 107 wæs gehyrsum on mode, 108 geaf hire ðone mod and ða eagan ðær hire leof wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Non scese mai con sì veloce moto 110 foco di spessa nube, quando piove 111 da quel confine che più va remoto,
query.error: **English:** 109 Never did fire descend with such swift motion 110 from a thick cloud, when it rains 111 from that boundary which is most remote,
query.result: 109 Ne æfre fyres flyht swâ fûs ne wæs 110 of þære lyfte, þonne hit of þære lyfte cymeð, 111 of þam gemære þe hit fyrrest mæg,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 com’ io vidi calar l’uccel di Giove 113 per l’alber giù, rompendo de la scorza, 114 non che d’i fiori e de le foglie nove;
query.error: **English:** 112 as I saw the bird of Jove descend 113 down through the tree, breaking off the bark, 114 not just of the flowers and the new leaves;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 e ferì ’l carro di tutta sua forza; 116 ond’ el piegò come nave in fortuna, 117 vinta da l’onda, or da poggia, or da orza.
query.error: **English:** 115 and it struck the chariot with all its force; 116 whereupon it tilted like a ship in a storm, 117 overcome by the waves, now from the starboard, now from the larboard.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Poscia vidi avventarsi ne la cuna 119 del trïunfal veiculo una volpe 120 che d’ogne pasto buon parea digiuna;
query.error: **English:** 118 Then I saw a fox rush into the cradle 119 of the triumphal chariot, 120 who seemed to fast from every good food;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 ma, riprendendo lei di laide colpe, 122 la donna mia la volse in tanta futa 123 quanto sofferser l’ossa sanza polpe.
query.error: **English:** 121 but, rebuking her for her ugly sins, 122 my lady put her to such flight 123 as her fleshless bones could endure.
query.result: 121 ac ða min lafdi hine of ðære lænan 122 mid ðære sweopan ut adrifon, 123 swa ðæt he ða næfde nænne cræft.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Poscia per indi ond’ era pria venuta, 125 l’aguglia vidi scender giù ne l’arca 126 del carro e lasciar lei di sé pennuta;
query.error: **English:** 124 Then, from where it had come before, 125 I saw the eagle descend into the ark 126 of the chariot and leave it feathered with itself;
query.result: 124 ða ðanon ðær hit wæs ær cumen, 125 ðone earn ic geseah stigan of heofonum 126 on ðære earce ðæs wænes and ða wæn forlætan

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 e qual esce di cuor che si rammarca, 128 tal voce uscì del cielo e cotal disse: 129 «O navicella mia, com’ mal se’ carca!».
query.error: **English:** 127 and as a voice comes from a heart that grieves, 128 such a voice came from heaven and said: 129 "O my little ship, how badly you are laden!"
query.result: 127 afeðerod; and swa swa ðæs monnes stefn 128 of ðam heortan gæð ðe hreowig bið, 129 swylc stefn ða com of ðam heofonum

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Poi parve a me che la terra s’aprisse 131 tr’ambo le ruote, e vidi uscirne un drago 132 che per lo carro sù la coda fisse;
query.error: **English:** 130 Then it seemed to me that the earth opened up 131 between the two wheels, and I saw a dragon emerge 132 that fixed its tail on the chariot;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 e come vespa che ritragge l’ago, 134 a sé traendo la coda maligna, 135 trasse del fondo, e gissen vago vago.
query.error: **English:** 133 and like a wasp that retracts its sting, 134 drawing its evil tail back to itself, 135 it pulled itself out from the abyss and darted away.
query.result: 133 and swa wæps ðe ðone sting eft in teoð, 134 ða tægle to hire, ða heo ðone ættor ut abræd, 135 heo ða of ðam grunde grundum wæs afaren, and ða wæs on fleame.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Quel che rimase, come da gramigna 137 vivace terra, da la piuma, offerta 138 forse con intenzion sana e benigna,
query.error: **English:** 136 That which remained, like little weeds 137 on fertile soil, from the feathers, offered 138 perhaps with good and kind intentions,
query.result: 136 Þæt ðe ðær læf, swa ðæs gærses wyrt 137 on ðære moldan fæðme, ðurh ðæs fugles cræft, 138 ðurh ðæs monnes geþoht, ðe hit ðær gesette,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 si ricoperse, e funne ricoperta 140 e l’una e l’altra rota e ’l temo, in tanto 141 che più tiene un sospir la bocca aperta.
query.error: **English:** 139 covered itself, and covered both 140 wheels and axle, in so much time 141 that a sigh keeps the mouth open longer.
query.result: 139 oferwearð eall, and ða wægnas twegen 140 and ðone sweoran, on ðam fæce, on ðam færelde, 141 ðæt ðæs monnes sigebeam syððan ne mihte

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Trasformato così ’l dificio santo 143 mise fuor teste per le parti sue, 144 tre sovra ’l temo e una in ciascun canto.
query.error: **English:** 142 Thus transformed, the holy edifice 143 put forth heads throughout its parts, 144 three on the beam and one at each corner.
query.result: 142 Þus awend, se halga ðing, 143 sette ut heafda ðurh his limu, 144 ðreo ofer ðam teame and an æt ægðrum ende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 Le prime eran cornute come bue, 146 ma le quattro un sol corno avean per fronte: 147 simile mostro visto ancor non fue.
query.error: **English:** 145 The first were horned like oxen, 146 but the four had only one horn on their foreheads: 147 such a monster was never seen before.
query.result: 145 Þa æroran wæron gehyrnede swa oxan, 146 ac ða feower hæfdon an horn on heora agan brond: 147 swylc nyten gesewen næfre ær ne wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
148 Sicura, quasi rocca in alto monte, 149 seder sovresso una puttana sciolta 150 m’apparve con le ciglia intorno pronte;
query.error: **English:** 148 Secure, like a fortress on a high mountain, 149 she sat upon a loose harlot, 150 and she appeared to me with her eyes alert all around;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
151 e come perché non li fosse tolta, 152 vidi di costa a lei dritto un gigante; 153 e basciavansi insieme alcuna volta.
query.error: **English:** 151 and as if so that she would not be taken from him, 152 I saw a giant standing beside her; 153 and sometimes they would kiss each other.
query.result: 151 and swylce heo ne wurde him awended, 152 ic geseah ðær standan stiðne gigant 153 and hi tosomne clyppedon hwæthwugu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
154 Ma perché l’occhio cupido e vagante 155 a me rivolse, quel feroce drudo 156 la flagellò dal capo infin le piante;
query.error: **English:** 154 But because my lustful and wandering eye 155 turned to me that fierce lover, 156 he scourged her from head to foot;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
157 poi, di sospetto pieno e d’ira crudo, 158 disciolse il mostro, e trassel per la selva, 159 tanto che sol di lei mi fece scudo
query.error: **English:** 157 then, full of suspicion and cruel with anger, 158 he untied the monster and dragged it through the wood, 159 so that he made me a shield from her alone
query.result: 157 ða, mid andan full and mid yrre reðe, 158 he unband ðone deofol and hine ðurh ðone wudu brohte, 159 oð ðæt he geworhte ðæt he me ana wearð

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
160 a la puttana e a la nova belva.
query.error: **English:** 160 against the whore and the new beast.
query.result: 160 to scylde wið ða mynecene and ða niwan deofol-nyten.
